node.title: How many people have been vaccinated in Wales?
node.description: The vaccine programme is focusing on booster jabs and first doses for 12 to 15-year-olds.
node.content:
["", "
Booster jabs being given out in Cwmbran
", "The Cwm Taf Morgannwg health board area is ahead of the rest of Wales in giving vaccines to 12 to 15-year-olds, latest figures from Public Health Wales show.", "Rhondda Cynon Taf, Merthyr Tydfil and Bridgend have reached more than half of that age group by last Sunday.", "Other south Wales valleys areas, as well as Monmouthshire and Ceredigion had also reached more than 40%.", "But the rate drops to 21.5% in north Wales and is just 8.2% in Neath Port Talbot.", "Only 60 12 to 15-year-olds were given a dose in the last week in Neath Port Talbot, according to the figures.", "The next lowest council area in Wales was Denbighshire with 17.9%.", "Cwm Taf Morgannwg health board, which was sending out offers of appointments in the post, has also set up an advice line for young people and their parents.", "The overall figure for vaccinations in Wales of 12 to 15-year-olds had risen to 32% by Wednesday night.", "
Booster jabs for over 50s
", "Figures are expected to be published next week for booster jabs but so far we only know 130,000 have been given out in Wales, up to 4 October.", "Meanwhile, 74.1% of 16 and 17-year-olds have now had first doses of Covid-19 vaccines.", "Just over 21,612 first and second doses were given out in the last week, slightly up on the previous week's total, with 75% of them first doses and around two thirds of them being given to 12 to 15 year-olds.", "Across Wales, 74.1% of 16 and 17-year-olds had been vaccinated by Wednesday night.", "", "
1px transparent line
", "Powys and Rhondda Cynon Taf had the biggest proportion of vaccinated 16 and 17-year-olds, while north and west Wales local authority areas had the lowest rates with that age group. Denbighshire had only reached just over two thirds.", "There are still around 18,160 and 17-year-olds who have not taken up the offer of a first dose and more than 107,700 people aged 18 to 29.", "
Who else has been vaccinated in Wales so far?
", "While numbers have plateaued for all ages, a high proportion of the older and more vulnerable groups have been reached.", "Between 92.4% and 96.3% of those in age groups over 60 have received two doses of vaccine and more than 88% of those in their 50s.", "", "
1px transparent line
", "We can see more than 82.2% of those in their 40s and 73.4% of those in their 30s have now had second jabs.", "As well as the different age groups, 95.5% of healthcare workers had been given two doses by Wednesday, as well as 86% of clinically at-risk groups aged under 65.", "
How many have received a first dose?
", "Wales is slightly behind Scotland with the proportions of their populations given a first jab.", "By 20 October, more than 2.4 million people in Wales had been given their first dose, or 76.4% of the population, compared with 78.6% in Scotland. ", "When we just look at the ages over 12, 88% of that age range has been given a first dose.", "", "
UK vaccines map
", "", "
1px transparent line
", "
What is happening with second doses?
", "A total of 2,238,258people have received a second jab, or 70.4% of the total population. That is 81.3% of the over 12s.", "Wales was the first UK nation to reach the 50% milestone and passed the two-thirds mark in early August.", "", "
Global vaccination chart
", "", "
1px transparent line
", "Wales and Scotland are close together on the proportions of second vaccinations.", "By 20 October England was on 67.4% and Northern Ireland trailing a little on 65.2%.", "For the proportion of its population fully vaccinated Wales is still ranked 14th in the world, compared with other nations with a population above 1 million.", "", "
Vaccination map of Wales
", "When we look at figures within Wales, we can see Powys reached nearly 82% of its total population with first doses. ", "It has also reached 77% with a second dose, or 88.9% of adults over 18.", "All health boards have fully vaccinated more than two-thirds of their populations.", "At a local authority level, Monmouthshire has reached the highest proportion of over 18s (89.9% given two doses) and Cardiff the fewest (77.8%).", "Most areas have given first doses to at least three-quarters of the 18 to 29 age group but that drops to 69.7% in Ceredigion.", "The highest proportion is 85.6% in Monmouthshire.", "Betsi Cadwaladr health board in north Wales - Wales' largest - has now given doses to more than 1m people.", "This does not include booster jabs.", "The first and second doses total has passed 4.6m across Wales.", "Gap in poorest parts of Wales", "A gap has already opened for Covid vaccinations of 16 and 17 year-olds in the poorest parts of Wales, compared with those living in the least deprived areas, Public Health Wales figures show.", "It is the first time we can see a breakdown in terms of gender, economic background and ethnic group for how the vaccination programme is reaching teenagers. ", "Only 61% of 16 and 17-year-olds in the most deprived areas had been given a first vaccine dose, compared with 78.3% of those in the least deprived areas (a gap of 17.3 percentage points). ", "Up to 10 September, that was 3,449 young people in the poorest areas yet to take up a first dose.", "There is far less of a gap between 16 and 17-year-olds from black, Asian and minority ethnic backgrounds (BAME) and their white counterparts - 8.8 percentage points.", "The widest gap among BAME age groups is for those in their 30s where only 64% have so far had a first Covid vaccine dose, compared with 80.7% of white people in their 30s. ", "That gap has only slightly narrowed from 16.9 percentage points in August to 16.7 percentage points in September.", "For 16 and 17-year-olds girls (70%) are slightly ahead of boys (66.4%).", "This feature is next due to be updated on Thursday 28 October, so some figures will change in the meantime."]
